innhold.avsnitt: Pregnancy allowance is calculated based on your income. You can get paid pregnancy income up to six times the basic amount.

Are you an employee your pregnancy allowance is usually considered based on the average income you have had in the last three calendar months before you receive your maternity benefit. This applies both if you are a permanent employed or have varying periods of work or income. If there is more than 25 percent difference between your annual income and your income over the last three months, we need to consider which income is most representative in your situation.

liste.punkt: Have your employment been varied for three months, the pregnancy allowance must be calculated based on the income you have had during the period you have been in work. Your income is converted into a monthly income.
Have you had vacation or short periods of random unpaid leave during the period you have earned, your income is determined by what you would normally have if you had been working.

innhold.avsnitt: Your pregnancy allowance will be calculated on the basis of the average of the income that you have had in the last three calendar months before the start of your pregnancy allowance period.
If the difference between your annual income and your income in the past three months is greater than 25 per cent, we must assess which income is most representative in your situation.

innhold.avsnitt: Are you self-employed employed your pregnancy allowance is usually calculated as the average of your income in the last three years for which tax has been assessed.

If your business or work situation has changed permanently, the income you had when you start with a pregnancy allowance can be used instead. Income over six times the National Insurance basic amount("G") is not included in the calculation.
